abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Social Action Fund Project
            will improve access to basic services for the poor in rural,
            and peri-urban areas, through the rehabilitation of
            community infrastructure in health, education, and
            sanitation, as a follow-up of the first phase. Therefore,
            the second phase includes roads rehabilitation, and,
            construction of small bridges, market buildings, small-scale
            irrigation, and reforestation sub-projects. However, this
            environmental assessment identifies a special concern
            regarding the "chimapacas", shallow water
            reservoirs, with severely degraded, stagnant water, but a
            major source of drinking water, which endangers health, with
            the increased risk of malaria. Mitigating measures address:
            1) construction, and use of chimpacas should not be
            considered, rather through technical assistance, a properly
            designed well system should be built for human consumption
            needs. In addition, capacity building should be increased
            within the local water departments, and, monitoring of water
            quality established, through environmental technologies; 2)
            soil erosion, water pollution, and flooding should be
            controlled by limiting infrastructure rehabilitation to the
            dry season, through appropriate disposal of oil and solid
            wastes, and, re-vegetation practices to restore natural
            habitats; 3) irrigation systems should ascertain groundwater
            uses, build drainage systems to prevent water-logging, and,
            create terraces, or contour ploughing to slow runoffs; and,
            4) sanitation, and hygiene education, to train communities
            on the uses of new facilities, and, on the operation, and
            maintenance of water systems.
